column4: are you using ioQuake when you are getting sound?  I have never gotten sound from the points release of Quake 3 for a long time.
heh it's an interesting problem. ioquake gives me sound but puts my monitor out of scan range by default... so I use the point release.... I had to install a libsdl for pulse I think
have a look at libsdl1.2debian-pulseaudio and try again if you feel up to it.
thanks!
other then installing libsdl1.2debian-pulseaudio was there anything else you had to do?  it was already installed on my system.
did you get it working?
nope :(  tried using 32bit version of library as well, no go.  I've tried numberous times to get Quake 3 sound working, haven't in probably 2 years
i didn't notice you PM - thanks man, that worked!  Sound in Q3, amazing.
cool. Glad I could help.
keep that line you added handy though, that may get removed form the file after updates.
if you want smp to work add the line "quake3-smp.x86 0 0 direct"
heh why didn't I realize that.
CS isn't a game i play - but you might be interested in the games i have running on Lucid http://sites.google.com/site/alucidfs/gaming
nice I'll check it out
Ubuntu does not do rolling updates - so you should never see "new" packages, just security/bug fixes
only when a new version comes out - then there are new packages
are you using nvidia?
yes
sudo mv /etc/xorg.conf /etc/xorg.conf.orig then "sudo nvidia-xconfig", then try restarting GDM "sudo service gdm restart"
sorry it's /etc/X11/
awsome!
